resources.string: Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands, with Honshu being the largest and most populous of them all.
Mount Fuji, Japan’s tallest mountain at 3,776 meters, is an iconic symbol and a popular climbing destination.
Japan has one of the world’s highest life expectancies, with an average of over 84 years for both genders.
Tokyo, Japan’s capital, is the most populous metropolitan area in the world, home to over 37 million people.
Japan experiences around 1,500 earthquakes annually due to its location on the Pacific Ring of Fire tectonic zone.
Shinkansen, or bullet trains, can reach speeds of up to 320 km/h and are famous for their punctuality and safety.
Sumo wrestling is Japan’s national sport, rooted in ancient Shinto rituals and performed in large clay rings called dohyō.
Japan has more vending machines per capita than any other country, selling everything from drinks to umbrellas and hot meals.
The Japanese writing system combines three scripts: Kanji, Hiragana, and Katakana, each used for different linguistic functions.
Cherry blossom season, or Sakura, is a major cultural event celebrated with picnics and festivals throughout Japan in spring.
Japan is home to 25 UNESCO World Heritage Sites, including historic temples, shrines, castles, and natural wonders like Yakushima Island.
Japanese cuisine emphasizes seasonality and presentation, with sushi, ramen, tempura, and wagyu beef known around the world.
Japan has a strong tradition of craftsmanship, producing high-quality goods such as ceramics, swords, textiles, and electronics.
The country’s population is rapidly aging, with nearly 30% of Japanese people over the age of 65 as of recent years.
Kyoto, the ancient capital, is known for its well-preserved temples, gardens, geisha culture, and traditional wooden architecture.
Japanese schoolchildren clean their classrooms and facilities themselves, as part of teaching responsibility and community values.
Japan’s culture blends ancient traditions with modern innovation, from tea ceremonies and kabuki theater to robotics and anime.
